TypeSignature.Value: .class public interface auto ansi abstract IPreparedStatement implements class Android.Runtime.IJavaObject, class Java.Sql.IStatement, class Java.Sql.IWrapper, class System.IDisposable

Docs.summary: An interface for a precompiled SQL Statement.

remarks.para: An interface for a precompiled SQL Statement.
An SQL Statement is put into a PreparedStatement and is precompiled so that it can be executed efficiently multiple times.
Setter methods are supplied in the PreparedStatement interface for the setting of IN parameters for the statement. The setter method used for each IN parameter must match the parameter's type.

MemberSignature.Value: public void AddBatch ();
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void AddBatch() cil managed

Docs.summary: Add a set of parameters to the PreparedStatement's command batch.

remarks.para: Add a set of parameters to the PreparedStatement's command batch.

MemberSignature.Value: public void ClearParameters ();
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void ClearParameters() cil managed

Docs.summary: Clear the current parameter values.

remarks.para: Clear the current parameter values.

Typically, parameter values are retained for multiple executions of the Statement. Setting a parameter value replaces the previous value. This method clears the values for all parameters, releasing all resources used by those parameters.

MemberSignature.Value: public bool Execute ();
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance bool Execute() cil managed

Docs.summary: Executes the SQL statement in this PreparedStatement.

remarks.para: Executes the SQL statement in this PreparedStatement.

A PreparedStatement may return multiple results. The execute method executes the PreparedStatement and returns a flag indicating the kind of result produced by the action. The methods getResultSet or getUpdateCount are used to retrieve the first result, and the second and subsequent results are retrieved with getMoreResults.

MemberSignature.Value: public Java.Sql.IResultSet ExecuteQuery ();
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class Java.Sql.IResultSet ExecuteQuery() cil managed

Docs.summary: Executes the SQL query in the PreparedStatement and returns the ResultSet generated by the query.

remarks.para: Executes the SQL query in the PreparedStatement and returns the ResultSet generated by the query.

Docs.exception: if a database error happens or if the SQL statement does not produce a ResultSet.

MemberSignature.Value: public int ExecuteUpdate ();
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance int32 ExecuteUpdate() cil managed

Docs.summary: Invokes the SQL command contained within the prepared statement.

remarks.para: Invokes the SQL command contained within the prepared statement. This must be INSERT, UPDATE, DELETE, or a command that returns nothing.

Docs.exception: if a database error happens or if the SQL statement returns a ResultSet.

MemberSignature.Value: public Java.Sql.IResultSetMetaData MetaData { get; }
.property instance class Java.Sql.IResultSetMetaData MetaData

Attribute.AttributeName: get: Android.Runtime.Register("getMetaData", "()Ljava/sql/ResultSetMetaData;", "GetGetMetaDataHandler:Java.Sql.IPreparedStatementInvoker, Mono.Android, Version=0.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=null")

Docs.summary: Returns a ResultSetMetaData describing the ResultSet that would be produced by execution of the PreparedStatement.

remarks.para: Returns a ResultSetMetaData describing the ResultSet that would be produced by execution of the PreparedStatement.

It is possible to know the metadata for the ResultSet without executing the PreparedStatement, because the PreparedStatement is precompiled. As a result the metadata can be queried ahead of time without actually executing the statement.

Docs.exception: if there is a database error.

MemberSignature.Value: public Java.Sql.IParameterMetaData ParameterMetaData { get; }
.property instance class Java.Sql.IParameterMetaData ParameterMetaData

Docs.summary: Gets information about the parameters of the PreparedStatement.

remarks.para: Gets information about the parameters of the PreparedStatement.

Docs.summary: Sets the value of a specified parameter to the content of a supplied InputStream, which has a specified number of bytes.

remarks.para: Sets the value of a specified parameter to the content of a supplied InputStream, which has a specified number of bytes.

This is a good method for setting an SQL LONGVARCHAR parameter where the length of the data is large. Data is read from the InputStream until end-of-file is reached or the specified number of bytes is copied.

remarks.para: Sets the value of a specified parameter to a supplied java.sql.Date value, using a supplied Calendar to map the Date. The Calendar allows the application to control the timezone used to compute the SQL DATE in the database - without the supplied Calendar, the driver uses the VM defaults. See "Be wary of the default locale".

MemberSignature.Value: public void SetNull (int parameterIndex, int sqlType);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void SetNull(int32 parameterIndex, int32 sqlType) cil managed

Docs.param: the parameter number index, where the first parameter has index 1.
the SQL type of the parameter, as defined in java.sql.Types.
Docs.summary: Sets the value of a specified parameter to SQL NULL.

remarks.para: Sets the value of a specified parameter to SQL NULL. Don't use this version of setNull for User Defined Types (UDT) or for REF type parameters.

MemberSignature.Value: public void SetNull (int paramIndex, int sqlType, string typeName);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void SetNull(int32 paramIndex, int32 sqlType, string typeName) cil managed

Docs.param: the parameter number index, where the first parameter has index 1.
the SQL type of the parameter, as defined in java.sql.Types.
the fully qualified name of a UDT or REF type - ignored if the parameter is not a UDT.
Docs.summary: Sets the value of a specified parameter to SQL NULL.

remarks.para: Sets the value of a specified parameter to SQL NULL. This version of setNull should be used for User Defined Types (UDTs) and also REF types. UDTs can be STRUCT, DISTINCT, JAVA_OBJECT and named array types.

Applications must provide the SQL type code and also a fully qualified SQL type name when supplying a NULL UDT or REF. For a UDT, the type name is the type name of the parameter itself, but for a REF parameter the type name is the type name of the referenced type.

MemberSignature.Value: public void SetObject (int parameterIndex, Java.Lang.Object theObject);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void SetObject(int32 parameterIndex, class Java.Lang.Object theObject) cil managed

Docs.param: the parameter number index, where the first parameter has index 1.
the object containing the value to which the parameter at parameterIndex is set.
Docs.summary: Sets the value of a specified parameter using a supplied object.

remarks.para: Sets the value of a specified parameter using a supplied object.

There is a standard mapping from Java types to SQL types, defined in the JDBC specification. The passed object is then transformed into the appropriate SQL type, and then transferred to the database. setObject can be used to pass abstract data types unique to the database, by using a JDBC driver specific Java type. If the object's class implements the interface SQLData, the JDBC driver calls SQLData.writeSQL to write it to the SQL data stream. If the object's class implements Ref, Blob, Clob, Struct, or Array, the driver passes it to the database as a value of the corresponding SQL type.

MemberSignature.Value: public void SetObject (int parameterIndex, Java.Lang.Object theObject, int targetSqlType);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void SetObject(int32 parameterIndex, class Java.Lang.Object theObject, int32 targetSqlType) cil managed

Docs.param: the parameter index, where the first parameter has index 1.
the Object containing the value to which the parameter at parameterIndex is set.
the SQL type to send to the database, as defined in java.sql.Types.
Docs.summary: Sets the value of a specified parameter using a supplied object.

remarks.para: Sets the value of a specified parameter using a supplied object.

The object is converted to the given targetSqlType before it is sent to the database. If the object has a custom mapping (its class implements the interface SQLData), the JDBC driver will call the method SQLData.writeSQL to write it to the SQL data stream. If the object's class implements Ref, Blob, Clob, Struct, or Array, the driver will pass it to the database in the form of the relevant SQL type.

MemberSignature.Value: public void SetObject (int parameterIndex, Java.Lang.Object theObject, int targetSqlType, int scale);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void SetObject(int32 parameterIndex, class Java.Lang.Object theObject, int32 targetSqlType, int32 scale) cil managed

Docs.param: the parameter index, where the first parameter has index 1.
the Object containing the value to which the parameter at parameterIndex is set.
the SQL type to send to the database, as defined in java.sql.Types.
the number of digits after the decimal point - only applies to the types java.sql.Types.DECIMAL and java.sql.Types.NUMERIC - ignored for all other types.
Docs.summary: Sets the value of a specified parameter using a supplied object.

remarks.para: Sets the value of a specified parameter using a supplied object.

The object is converted to the given targetSqlType before it is sent to the database. If the object has a custom mapping (its class implements the interface SQLData), the JDBC driver will call the method SQLData.writeSQL to write it to the SQL data stream. If the object's class implements Ref, Blob, Clob, Struct, or Array, the driver will pass it to the database in the form of the relevant SQL type.

Docs.summary: Sets the value of a specified parameter to a supplied java.sql.Time value, using a supplied Calendar.

remarks.para: Sets the value of a specified parameter to a supplied java.sql.Time value, using a supplied Calendar.
The driver uses the supplied Calendar to create the SQL TIME value, which allows it to use a custom timezone - otherwise the driver uses the VM defaults. See "Be wary of the default locale".

Docs.summary: Sets the value of a specified parameter to the characters from a supplied InputStream, with a specified number of bytes.

remarks.para: Sets the value of a specified parameter to the characters from a supplied InputStream, with a specified number of bytes.
